intro: Angelica curtisii, commonly known as the Sierra angelica, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, branched stems and large, compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its roots are thick and fleshy, often used in traditional herbal medicine. Angelica curtisii thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions.
